localizedDescriptions.en: A framework to communicate information that has been captured and curated in anticipation of future need for care.
Additional composition metadata aligned with IHE-XDS which is not already available from the Reference Model COMPOSITION class.
The code specifying the precise type of document from the user perspective. Normally selected from a valueset provided by the local IHE-XDS Affinity Domain or national standard.

annotations.comment:
for example:  Pulmonary History and Physical, Discharge Summary, Ultrasound Report.
These codes are specific to an XDS Affinity Domain.

localizedDescriptions.en: Personal patient details
Name details aligned with FHIR resource.
Identification of the purpose for the name.
A nickname.
Family name or surname.
Given name, not always first and includes middle name(s).
Given name, not always first and includes middle name(s).
Name details aligned with FHIR resource.
Identification of the purpose for the name.
The usual name.
A text representation of the full name.
FHIR telecom details.
Telecommunications form for contact point - what communications system is required to make use of the contact.
The actual contact point details, in a form that is meaningful to the designated communication system (i.e. phone number or email address).
Specifies a preferred order in which to use a set of contacts. Contacts are ranked with lower values coming before higher values.
FHIR telecom details.
Telecommunications form for contact point - what communications system is required to make use of the contact.
The actual contact point details, in a form that is meaningful to the designated communication system (i.e. phone number or email address).
Tp capture Care plan metadata
The name , preferably coded of the Care plan with which this journey is associated, and against which the composition was updated.
The identifier , preferably coded, of the Care plan with which this journey is associated, and against which the composition was updated.
A patient-journey specific identifier i.e unique to a patient's journey along a specific care pathway.

localizedDescriptions.en: Summary information about social circumstances or experiences that may have a potential impact on an individual's health.
Identification of the individual's religious or non-religious beliefs and/or practices by which people order the conduct of their lives both practically and in a moral sense.

annotations.comment: For example: Christianity, Catholicism, Islam, Wicca, Humanism, Animism, Atheism; Agnosticism; or none.

localizedDescriptions.en: Name of the belief and/or practice to which the individual is affiliated.

annotations.comment: For example: Christianity; Catholicism; Islam; Wiccan; Humanism; Animism; Atheism; Agnosticism; or none. Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible.

localizedDescriptions.en: The ability of an individual to communicate.
Preferred language and/or method of communication for an individual.
A collection of words, their pronunciation and methods for combining them, understood by a specific community and used as a form of communication.
The name of the language.

annotations.comment: For example: Mandarin, Swahili, French or Norwegian sign language. Coding of 'Language' with a terminology is preferred, where possible. ISO 639-3 codes include the simple name of the language but can represent the name and modality combined - for example Norwegian sign language. The value set for codes that are appropriate may depend on the mode.

localizedDescriptions.en: The person does not normally need an interpreter.
The person normally needs an interpreter.
Other language, and/or method of communication that could be used for an individual.
A collection of words, their pronunciation and methods for combining them, understood by a specific community and used as a form of communication.
The name of the language.

annotations.comment: For example: Mandarin, Swahili, French or Norwegian sign language. Coding of 'Language' with a terminology is preferred, where possible. ISO 639-3 codes include the simple name of the language but can represent the name and modality combined - for example Norwegian sign language. The value set for codes that are appropriate may depend on the mode.

localizedDescriptions.en: Additional narrative about the specific language capability not captured in other fields.

The person normally needs an interpreter.
The preferred language or other method of communication of a parent or carer.
A collection of words, their pronunciation and methods for combining them, understood by a specific community and used as a form of communication.
The name of the language.

annotations.comment: For example: Mandarin, Swahili, French or Norwegian sign language. Coding of 'Language' with a terminology is preferred, where possible. ISO 639-3 codes include the simple name of the language but can represent the name and modality combined - for example Norwegian sign language. The value set for codes that are appropriate may depend on the mode.

localizedDescriptions.en: Additional narrative about the specific language capability not captured in other fields.
The person does not normally need an interpreter.
The person normally needs an interpreter.
Identification of an aid to assist communication.

annotations.comment: For example: a hearing aid or tactile reading device. Coding of 'Communication aid' with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Details about the actual communication aid should preferably be recorded using the EVALUATION.device_summary archetype.

localizedDescriptions.en: Identification by an individual with a social and cultural grouping.
Name of the social or cultural group, usually self-described.

annotations.comment:
For example: Australian; Torrer Strait Islander; Maori; Roma Gypsy; Sikh. 
Individuals may identify with more than one social or cultural groups based on a long shared history; cultural tradition (including family and social customs); being a minority within the broader population; having a racially different appearance; or having a common geographic origin, language, literature or religion.
Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible, for example: ABS 1249.0 - Australian Standard Classification of Cultural and Ethnic Groups (ASCCEG), 2019.

localizedDescriptions.en: Name of the social or cultural group, usually self-described.

annotations.comment:
For example: Australian; Torrer Strait Islander; Maori; Roma Gypsy; Sikh. 
Individuals may identify with more than one social or cultural groups based on a long shared history; cultural tradition (including family and social customs); being a minority within the broader population; having a racially different appearance; or having a common geographic origin, language, literature or religion.
Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible, for example: ABS 1249.0 - Australian Standard Classification of Cultural and Ethnic Groups (ASCCEG), 2019.

localizedDescriptions.en: Name of the social or cultural group, usually self-described.

annotations.comment:
For example: Australian; Torrer Strait Islander; Maori; Roma Gypsy; Sikh. 
Individuals may identify with more than one social or cultural groups based on a long shared history; cultural tradition (including family and social customs); being a minority within the broader population; having a racially different appearance; or having a common geographic origin, language, literature or religion.
Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible, for example: ABS 1249.0 - Australian Standard Classification of Cultural and Ethnic Groups (ASCCEG), 2019.

localizedDescriptions.en: Details about the gender of an individual.
The individual's perception of their own gender.

annotations.comment: For example: 'male'; 'female'; or 'non-binary'. Coding with a terminology is recommended, where possible.

localizedLabels.en: Not stated (person asked but declined to provide a response)

localizedDescriptions.en: The pronoun an individual chooses to identify with, and would prefer others to use when talking to or about that individual.
Sexual orientation as described by the NHS Sexual Orientation monitoring standard.

1. Heterosexual or Straight
2. Gay or Lesbian
3. Bisexual
4. Other sexual orientation not listed 
U. Person asked and does not know or is not sure
Z. Not stated (person asked but declined to provide a response)
9. Not known (not recorded

localizedDescriptions.en: Summary or persistent information about an individual's current and past jobs and/or roles.
Statement about the individual's current employment.

annotations.comment: For example: employed; unemployed; or not in labour force. Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible. Detail about each occupation can be recorded within the CLUSTER.occupation_record archetype.

localizedDescriptions.en: A single job or role carried out by an individual during a specified period of time.
The main job title or the role of the individual.

annotations.comment: For example: Chief Executive Officer; Carer; or Student. Each of these job titles or roles may be comprised of multiple duties.
